2134.subject: FYS
2134.descrlong: Group-centered exploration of what is now the United States and California in particular, through study of events, political developments, and diverse peoples of the colonial period through Reconstruction. By interpreting the past, student-historians form connections to current populations, political institutions and issues as they begin their transition to university life and active civic participation. Meets U.S. Histories and Democratic Participation requirement. (Offered every fall.)
